A coming of age film that has Saoirse Ronan giving one of her best performances of her young career. If you ever seen a Nicholas Sparks adapted movie, BROOKLYN is what those films should be. This is a drama with romance, but none of the sappiness. At the core, it is about a young woman who leaves Ireland to have a better life in America. The love story is secondary, but just as important because Eillis, (Ronan) faces a decision that will decide the rest of her life and affect her family and friends. The movie is about finding your home and following your heart.Grade: A
Another great Nick Hornby movie!

One of the best films I've seen this year. Just amazing performances all around especially Saoirse Ronan. The story is told so well, it leads the audience to an ending that just gave me chills it was so emotional. It's a period film, but a universal story told with great humor and incredible charm. Grade: A+
witty and beautiful. ..one of the most well written screenplays of 2015
A terrific script from Nick Hornby, and a tremendous lead performance by Saoirse Ronan, amongst others, transform a seemingly unsurprising story into a powerful romantic drama.

A charming film about an Irish girl's journey from County Wexford to the titular New York borough, mirroring her own maturing into womanhood, it is competently made and beautifully acted, in particular, Julie Waters' Mrs. Kehoe who brings the laughs, filtered through with a huge dose of Irish witticism and humour and Brid Brennan's Miss Kelly who aptly represents the small town mentality the main character is trying to escape from with her two bookending scenes. But this is Saoirse Ronan's film, whose nuanced performance brilliantly captures the introspective nature of the conflicts and the responsibilities she has to face as she blossoms into adulthood. Brooklyn is a very nice film but it leaves a somewhat syrupy and sentimental aftertaste - and while there is nothing wrong with that, it somewhat zaps the overall dramatic effect.

I'm typically not a big fan of traditional romance, but by injecting humor and the struggles of immigration into the storyline, this becomes far more than a simple romance. By creating well-drawn characters, Hornby does a phenomenal job of drawing you in and getting you emotionally invested. While Saoirse Ronan is getting a lot of attention for her work here (deservedly so) I thought it was actually Emory Cohen who stole the show.

Lush and lyrical. Sad...like having a potent wave of memories (you never had) but could have. Delicate lovely performance by Saoirse Ronan. Her love,Emory Cohen is someone to watch - he is so vibrant and fascinating to watch - he is going to be a BIG star. Go see it.

Feel good film of the year- I left the theater feeling so good. Great lead performance from the already great Saoise Ronan, funny supporting character from Julie Walters, script by Nick Hornby, score by Michael Brook (!! that's right, 4AD friends).
a gorgeously beautiful movie in so many, many ways!
BROOKLYN certainly lives up to its hype. Saoirse Ronan gives a luminous and memorising performance along with Emory Cohen and Julie Walters. May it win every award possible, I can't recommend enough.

This is a very beautiful film with a great story, well acted and, even though it had the potential to be a sappy love story, it thankfully was not. This movie is hard to fault, really amazing directing, great costumes and wonderful performances by pretty well all the cast. Julie Walters has a great role in it as a matriarchel hostel owner for Irish girls. The movie's about a small town Irish girl who immigrates to America in the 1950's with all the trials and tribulations involved in this brave endeavour. It transports you in a magnetic way - well worth a watch particularly as a date movie. I can fully understand why the critics are raving about this filme - highly recommended!
A lovely film, a simple story beautifully told, and impossible to dislike!

I was initially not keen to see this movie due to it looking like a retro chick flick, but I'm so glad that my friend persuaded me to go to see it, using the rating on this site as a reason.The story is engaging from start to finish, and the acting is excellent from all of the cast. Saoirse Ronan is outstanding in the lead role, and Emory Cohen is a name to look out for in the future as his performance as Tony was excellent.A great movie.

Brooklyn acts as a compelling romance and a thoughtful drama about change and transition. The relationships in the film sparkle and feel very genuine thanks to the actors and Nick Hornby's screenplay which knows exactly when to let the film speak through dialogue and when to let the moment simmer. Hornby allows the emotions to breathe on their own by avoiding clich�s with ease. The broad appeal of the emotions and themes allows for the audience to relate the process of change in Eilis's life to any transitional period in their own, which I found myself doing during and after the film. Saoirse Ronan carries this film on her shoulders in every scene, conveying all of the emotion of her emotional journey often without having to say anything. She really tells her characters story through her eyes and face, and it's hard to imagine the film working so well without her. She deserves all the Oscar consideration she can get. There are some solid supporting performances as well, notably from Emory Cohen and Julie Walters. It's a nice looking and nice feeling film that has subtle but great period aesthetics and visuals that enhance the emotion. A thoroughly enjoyable watch on a surface level that anyone can enjoy because Saoirse Ronan and director John Crowley make it easy to identify with the central character and to relate to her experience. There was an important point in the film where I didn't quite get the reason a character made a decision because it arose too quickly and was motivated by something that felt too external. It distanced me from the film a little and diminished the overall impact a bit for me. Nonetheless, I certainly felt like I came away from the film with a lot and really enjoyed my viewing experience. Would highly recommend. Hard not to like. Saoirse Ronan was great.
Don't miss this one.

This was super sweet. Ronan was a standout and it looks absolutely stunning. An Irish girl moves to start a new life in NYC in the 50's but is drawn back to Ireland which messes with her head. Walters is also worth the price of a ticket

A stunning piece of cinema. A story of migration that transcends generations told in such beautiful, cinematic lushness. Ronan (surely to be Oscar nominated for this) holds the main role with such grace and poise that I could sit and watch her on screen for hours: her acting is effortless. The costume, colour, setting and witty humour, courtesy of Walters, make this a spectacle to be seen. I cannot recommend this enough.
A romantic period piece with enough warmth to surpass the melodrama.

Brooklyn is one of the best films of the year! Saoirse Ronan is simply captivating - all the performances are fantastic! Watching the film is like sitting down with a warm cup of hot chocolate with a shot of whisky in it! I have know many Irish women and this film is a tribute to them! Don't miss this one!
One of the very best movies in decades ! Acting script set and costumes reign !Go see this film !
An endearing, touching coming of age romance featuring a mesmerising Saoirse Ronan.

Sometimes we make choices; sometimes they're made for us. Brooklyn is at once romantic and pragmatic, an immigration melodrama with the sumptuous palette and complex themes of Douglas Sirk. In the lead, Saoirse Ronan, perhaps the finest actress of her generation, is remarkable.
Truly enjoyable movie that I would highly recommend.
A movie so beautiful in texture and atmosphere, it brought tears to my eyes.

A pleasant drama centred on the migration of a young woman from Ireland to the US in the 1950s. The film succeeds on the strength of the performances and the poignancy of the move combined the comparisons it evokes

I went to see this movie last night based on all the critical acclaim it's receiving and I was totally blown away. One of the best movies of the year! A refreshing change from the 'usual tripe' that we're subjected to at the movies. Saoirse Ronan, who has been around forever finally gets her breakout/Oscar worthy performance as Eilish Lacey in this coming-of-age movie about love, tough decision and becoming independent. I loved how there's a strong female presence in the movie who all support one another. Emory Cohen melted my heart as Tony. Julie Walters plays the hilarious, no nonsense landlady.I feel it will do well during awards season. I can't recommend enough that one sees this movie.10/10.
A superb film which I saw with my two daughters. Very funny and quite moving. An incandescent performance from Ms. Ronan. In my opinion the year's best film.

Brooklyn is written by Nick Hornby and directed by John Crowley. It stars Saoirse Ronan, Emory Cohen, and Domhanall Gleeson.An Irish immigrant lands in 1950's Brooklyn, where she quickly falls into a new romance. When her past catches up with her, however, she must choose between two countries and the lives that exist within.This movie feels an awful lot like a Merchant Ivory movie, before they went downhill. This is probably the best period piece of the year simply because Brooklyn embraces the type of movie it is, whole heatedly.Brooklyn, in my humble opinion, is a wrought melodrama that is equal parts quaint as it is provocatively made. This movie was made to be perfect and that might very well be its largest flaw. Though that thought is paradoxical, it is well founded. Aside from my minor griping, I did appreciate this movie in its entirety.My personal favorite part of the movie, which I noticed from the very beginning, was the immaculate cinematography, done by Yves B�langer. Though to the common movie goers eye it seems rather ordinary, but to me it was what made the movie so engaging. The gentile blend of light and dark colors inside and outside make the movie well worth seeing on the big screen in its own right, but what really got me was the deft mixing of colors at the dining scenes where the beauty of Saoirse Ronan was brought out through her, emphasized, kind smile and innocent eyes.Speaking of the lead actress, Saoirse Ronan was impeccably cast in this movie. She plays her role magically and brings a lot to the metaphorical and literal table. She pulls off a role that people 3 times her age would have a hard time doing; given the fact that someone 3 times as old as her wouldn't be cast to play a 19 year old accountant. Ronan plays a sympathetic and quirky lead so well that she bring Ellis Lacey to life.The same goes for Emory Cohen in his portrayal as Tony, Ellis' new Italian boyfriend in the States. The two make a remarkable pair, with phenomenal chemistry and finesse. Cohen plays a large part in this movie and understands that he needed to strike a perfect blend of desperation, love and believability.The same can be said about Brooklyn's script and tender direction. The art of creating a drama is like walking a tight rope, filled with sharp and jagged edges known to all as clich�s. This movie, for the most part, avoids these dreaded obstacles, by opting to slowly but surely build up its heady themes. Though this may be true, this, said, slow pace and structure can, at times, make the film feel uneventful, which may turn off some viewers. The lucky ones who do stick around are rewarded with a deeply emotionally resonant conclusion, much like the Merchant Ivory classics. Though most clich�s are avoided, some were unfortunately injected into the plot, when writer, Nick Hornby, decided to occasionally over dramatize events in the movie. This at times feels desperate and at others feel just redundant, but nevertheless gets the message across to some degree.Brooklyn is an old fashioned period piece that offers fine acting, beautiful cinematography, charming writing grounded in reality, and thought provoking direction. Brooklyn gets a B+ or 7/10.
Wonderful movie, I wish they would make more like this...others must agree the theater was packed.
Nick Hornsby is great so the movie will be too.

One of the best films I have seen all year. A small, simple film that will move you to the core. Saoirse Ronan is outstanding as Eilish and I can see her getting Oscar nominated for Best Actress; probably other awards for film too. Julie Walters a fine performance as the landlady along with the boarding house scenes. Emory Cohen is a real marvel here, a surprise considering his performance in 'The Place Beyond the Pines'. Domhnall Gleeson is also great! Go see!!!!

Another outstanding and Oscar worthy performance by Saoirse Ronan. I loved 'Brooklyn'. It's the perfect coming-of-age tale about love, life and the pursuit of happiness. The rest of the cast are marvellous; Julie Walters, Domhnall Gleeson, Emory Cohen, Jim Broadbent and Emily Bett Rickards. Best film of the year for me. Highly recommended.
Beautiful movie. Evocative in every way . Saoirse Ronan is simply amazing. Luminous throughout. Loved Emory Cohen as well. The film is the definition of acting. Such strong performances.

Superbly cast, acted, written and economically plotted, this immigration love story has a classic feel, emotional weight, moments of sublime hilarity and a postive girl-power vibe that makes you wish you inhabited this films emotional airspace.
Film of the year. 5 out of 5.

Another incredible, Oscar worthy performance from Saoirse Ronan in "Brooklyn".Her performance played with my heart strings. I'm delighted that this film is finally her breakout in to more mature roles.

The most beautiful romantic and coming-of-age movie. Saoirse Ronan blew me away with her Oscar worthy performance. Julie Walters plays the hilarious landlady along with the boarding house girls. Emory Cohen who plays Tony melted my heart as did Domhnall Gleeson who plays Jim. The best film of the year for me. Go see you won't be disappointed.

Saw this movie last night and it honestly is the best movie I have seen in forever. Saoirse Ronan OMG she is some actress. Her performance puts her as frontrunner for an Oscar for sure. Emory Cohen and Domhnall Gleeson are incredible as is Julie Walters. Even though it's set in the 1950s it's still in some ways contemporary too. Can't recommend it enough!
Really loved this film, I was able to see it at a private screening. What a gem!

A young Irish girl (Saoirse Ronan) emigrates to New York in the early 1950s, falls in love, and then has to make a choice between returning to Ireland permanently or forging a different life in the US. Brooklyn is a heartfelt and convincing romance with an absolutely brilliant performance from Ronan, and supporting cast (the Irish landlady played by Julie Walters is particularly memorable). Adapted for the screen by Nick Hornby with unfussy direction from John Crowley, this is a great little film. Recommended!
Terrific coming of age drama.
Great film, really enjoyed and superb acting all round.

For me it's the best movie of 2015. Everything about 'BROOKLYN' is both acted and visually stunning. Saoirse Ronan deserves all the awards for her portrayal as Eilish Lacey in this coming-of-age tale about finding your way in life. Emory Cohen and Domhnall Gleeson are amazing too. Julie Walters and the other ladies in the boarding house are hilarious. We'll definitely be seeing both Saoirse and 'Brooklyn' at the Oscars! A must see!!

One of the best movies I have seen in a long time. A change from your typical movie. Saoirse Ronan gives her best (Oscar worthy) performance along with Emory Cohen. 'Brooklyn' resonates with those who have left home, moved abroad or are just simply finding their way in life. I highly recommend.

As perfect a film as I have seen in ages. The casting is just right, every performance is wonderfully authentic, and Saoirse Ronan is incandescent as a young Irish girl in the 1950's. It has been a long time since I saw a film whose love story really mattered or made me care, and the way "Brooklyn" depicts family dynamics will break your heart.

Saoirse Ronan is terrific in the lead role here and the production is also expertly crafted. What could have, in lesser hands, been sentimental claptrap here becomes a touching story about an Irish immigrant in 1950s Brooklyn. I very much liked this one... more so than I thought I would.
Absolutely beautiful film!
Every single aspect of the film is flawlessly executed. I don't normally do this but I really want to spread the word that Saoirse Ronan ought to be nominated for an Oscar for her portrayal.
A slow but effective romance/drama that makes you believe the characters you see are real people by avoiding the ridiculous ups and downs featured in other romance/dramas.
Original and heartfelt. Definitely one of the best feel good stories of the year.

The best film I have seen in a long time. Brooklyn proves that you don't need big budgets and CGI to make a decent film. Saoirse Ronan gives her career best, Oscar worthy performance. Emory Cohen and Julie Walters also shine. We'll definitely be seeing this movie clean up during award season. "If you don't like BROOKLYN movie, then you have no soul".-Steven Zietchik LA Times.

An Oscar-bait movie and one that your grandmother will surely eat up, I nevertheless connected with these characters and found it a beautiful depiction of the classical conflict of leaving home and finding your place in the world. Not a must-see film but works well within the predictable and conventional genre of period melodrama.
Saoirse Ronan gives an amazing performance in this movie along with Emory Cohen and Julie Walters. Oscar nominations on the way! Can't recommend enough...Go see!
This movie is WOW,WOW,WOW. A delight from start to finish. Saoirse and Emory give Oscar worthy performances.

The best film I've seen all year. A beautiful adaptation of Colm Toibin's novel that features Saoirse Ronan in her elegant and poignant portrayal of a story which is universal; the story of leaving home- and finding a new future and home for oneself. A classic film which captures the human emotion so well. Would recommend everyone to go see it.

What a beautifully filmmed and wonderfully acted film this is. It is also nice to see a film that is actually made for and meant for adults. The nostalgic setting only adds to the magic. Saoirse Ronan may get herself an Oscar nomination.

Brooklyn is a warm, old-school film with romantic moments and genuinely funny moments based on rich, amusing characters rather than straightforward jokes. Saoirse Ronan fills the screen with her sensitive performance, and everything about the film comes together to support her remarkable presence.
Saw this opening night of Vancovuer Film Festival. Beautifully acted and with glorious visuals. A must see for everyone who appreciates traditional and powerful filmmaking.
Starts a little slow, but then develops into a great love story. Be sure to go see this with someone you love.

Saw this during VIFF, and was such a delight, an easy moving, visually stunning piece. It's simple, which makes it all the more special..it's not about special effects, it's about the great story, was totally captivated.
Brilliant!! Great story, amazing photography, perfect casting - and Saoirse Ronan deserves an Oscar!!!

This film gives you all the feels and is the best I have seen all year. Superb performances from Saoirse, Emory, Julie and the girls in the boarding house. Emily Bett Rickards also stars! Saoirse and the film itself definitely deserve all the awards!! Highly recommended!
A wonderfully old-fashioned romance, Brooklyn is beautiful, heartwarming, and one of the best movies I've seen this year. Saoirse Ronan is PHENOMENAL and gives her best performance yet.

Beautifully shot and achingly heartfelt, "Brooklyn" may not have much in common with say "The Lords of Flatbush," but the beloved borough becomes as vital a character in this film about a young Irish lass sent to the land of opportunity in the early 1950s where immigrants from all over planted roots. The melting pot of Brooklyn becomes a vivid backdrop as Eilis Lacey struggles with homesickness while hoping to fulfill her family's hope of a better future in America. What I found most resonant about the film is its depiction of that rite of passage where we leave home, and then our subsequent return as visitor. Those conflicting emotions of security in where we come from and possibility in where we may go are explored with elegance, grace, and humor here. There is incredible richness in the direction by John Crowley and the screenplay by Nick Hornby, filled with exquisite details and sharp insights. What makes "Brooklyn" most distinguishable from many films is how it presents real people, mostly kind and sweet, just struggling with ordinary issues. Nothing is bloated to fit the melodramatic grandeur audiences come to expect. That said, within this intimate story there are memorable scenes of gorgeous cinematography, powerful imagery, and heartbreaking emotion. All the performances are brilliant, full of honesty and detail, but Saoirse Ronan as Eilis carries the film, in nearly every single scene, and she is compelling. With her expressive face and depth of feeling, the portrait she paints not only captivates but lives with you well beyond the final credits roll. Easily one of the year's best, do make a journey to "Brooklyn."

I pretty much loved this movie. I could relate to it at times, at other times I knew people like this, and I just found it so engaging. There was just one scene I didn't like, but I'm sure that part was in the book so they probably had to keep it in the movie. I think this is the type of movie almost everyone could enjoy.

Well told story of an Irish immigrant and her torn feelings between the old and the new. Saoirse Ronan grew to be a gorgeous young woman, and she still commands the screen with her performance; Emory Cohen was a nice surprise.
I am very much looking forward to the release of this movie. All the awards for Saoirse!!
Just the scene in the trailer when the boy at the dinner table says, We don't like Irish, we don't it's a fact! is so funny I have to see the movie even just for that moment.
Can't wait to see this film. I'm a fan of Saoirse and Domhnall. All the reviews have been amazing. I just know Saoirse's getting an Oscar!!!!
A bittersweet, insightful story and excellent performances from all especially Ronan. Pleasant and satisfying.
Incredible performance from Saoirse. She'll definitely be nominated for Best Actress.
Ronan is mesmerising. A very moving story.
Can't wait to see this film. Saoirse is superb! Best Actress Oscar nomination, please.

Saoirse Ronan's personal fashion show with beautiful graphics. A typical BBC pipeline product.
